Package regressionAnalysisCalc

Class FileManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • regressionAnalysisCalc.FileManager
  • public class FileManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for opening and reading (.txt) text files using Scanner for the Regression Analysis Calculator, following a specified format (see README.txt), and writing image files (.png) or (.jpg). This class is not meant to be instantiated.
    Version:
    Jan 2021
    Author:
    Katelyn Lam

      FileManager()

      Reads from a text file and sets the file name, values and units of independent and dependent variable.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileManager

        public FileManager()

    • Method Detail

      • openFile

        public static void openFile()
        Opens a correctly formatted text file (see README.txt), and records data for independent and dependent values. A message dialog is outputted if file cannot be found.

      • fileReader

        public static void fileReader()
        Reads from a text file and sets the file name, values and units of independent and dependent variable. Each value of the independent and dependent variables are stored as data points.

      • isFileOpened

        public static boolean isFileOpened()
        Returns state of whether a file has been opened successfully. A successful open operation means that the headings are recorded and there is a at least one set of data values.
        Returns:
        boolean - true if a file has been opened successfully, otherwise false

      • saveFile

        public static void saveFile​(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bi)
        Saves an image file as a .png or a .jpg to a chosen directory.
        Parameters:
        bi - A Java BufferedImage image that will be saved

      • convertPNGtoJPG

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage convertPNGtoJPG​(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bi)
        Converts a BufferedImage of type .png to a .jpg.
        Parameters:
        bi - Original BufferedImage with alpha (can be exported as .png)
        BufferedImage - New BufferedImage without alpha (can be exported as .jpg)

      • getIndependentValues

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> getIndependentValues()
        Returns the values of the independent variables of the data set
        Returns:
        List a list of the independent values of the set of data read from the file

      • getDependentValues

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> getDependentValues()
        Returns the values of the dependent variables of the data set
        Returns:
        List a list of the dependent values of the set of data read from the file

      • getAxisInfo

        public static java.lang.String[] getAxisInfo()
        Returns the information about the variable names and units in line 1 read from the file if formatted correctly. This information is used as labels for the axes of the graph displayed in GraphingTool
        Returns:
        String[] An array of the information for the axis labels, represented as: {independent variable name, dependent variable names, unit of independent variable, unit of dependent variable

      • getFileName

        public static java.lang.String getFileName()
        Returns the name of a currently opened file
        Returns:
        String - the name of the file that is opened in the main program
